intro: Eriocaulon articulatum, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small aquatic or semi-aquatic plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that are often difficult to see. Its rhizomes are typically short and branching, allowing it to spread vegetatively. Eriocaulon articulatum is often found in shallow water or moist soil, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
